intro: Clerodendrum eburneum, commonly known as the white corymbose clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
